text: [R&B MUSIC]
INTERVIEWER: OK, stand by.
And action.
[R&B MUSIC]

You're having an
incredible year.

The show and all the other
projects you're working on
takes up a lot of your time.

So we want to talk
about your last day off.

TIFFANY HADDISH:
My last day off.

I can't remember
my last day off.

Can somebody look
in the calendar
and see when my last day off is?
Oh, yes!

I had two days off, and I
decided that I didn't want

to be bothered with
nobody because I'm
sick of talking to people.

People always calling
my phone to talk to me.

And don't get me
wrong, I love all

my friends and my family and
stuff, but my job is to talk.

Like, I don't want to
talk to you right now.

I would prefer to just sit here
and pet my little white dog,
Sleeper, for sure.
[LAUGHTER]

INTERVIEWER: If you were to take
Sleeper on a day off adventure,
where would you take her?

TIFFANY HADDISH:
Depends on where we at.

If we in California, we
gonna go up to the mountains

and walk around, and
then I'll have a blanket,
a little picnic basket.

We'll just sit under
the trees in the trail
and eat sandwiches.

Well, I would eat a sandwich,
and she would probably

eat, like, some wet dog food
because that's, you know,
that's chic.
I probably would some weed.
I left that part out.

Yeah, I probably
would smoke some weed.
That would be nice.
[JAZZ MUSIC]

On this particular
day off, I did not

want to be responsible
for nobody but myself.
[JAZZ MUSIC]

So I drove up to
Boston all by myself

and listened to audio books
and some music and stuff.

At around 12:00, I
got hungry, and I
had a sandwich-- pastrami.
I like pastrami sandwiches.

Then I went to the
Beyoncé Jay-Z concert.

I went in there and was, like,
dancing, enjoying myself.

Some people came by and took
pictures with me, whatever.
Beyoncé saw me.
She's like, Tiffany!
And then I was like, ay!

And then I left, got in
the car, went to a hotel,

slept, like, a
majority of the day.

Woke up, drove back
towards New York.

I was in Connecticut, and I
saw there was, like, a lake.

I got out and put my feet in the
mud, connected with the Earth,

you know, did a
little grounding.

And then I was like, man,
I should go to the spa.

And I went and got
a massage, hung out

in the spa for a little
while, and that was great.

But, you know, ideally,
the perfect day off,

I would stay in
the house and sleep

all day, and sleeping
with Sleeper at my feet
and snore like a man.

When I wake up, maybe
have a shot of vodka.

Watch some cartoons like
"Family Guy," "Ninja
Turtles," "Cleveland Show."

I like those cartoons,
but they're also--
I like throwbacks.

"She-ra," "He-Man,"
stuff like that.
I kind of gotta pee pee now.
We're gonna go.

I think Sleeper
gotta pee pee, too.
All right, bye.
[R&B MUSIC]
